data.text: @TOCam29 @OntHospitalAssn @DFisman @BogochIsaac Thanks…3rd graph, yellow line: are new admits levelling or beginning to increase? Are there more discharges (green line) than admissions because they die or they came in with Covid but discharge diagnosis is different ? See Emergency department re:latter? @DFisman @BogochIsaac

@AnnieRinTO @OntHospitalAssn @DFisman @BogochIsaac That’s all available here - https://t.co/hQEcG2tmJf. New admits are well down from a month ago and are slightly above the levels seen during what could be considered low Covid times over the last two years or so.
@OntHospitalAssn I’m also wondering about emergency department admissions who never make it to an inpatient bed or ICU? Let’s track those too?

@OntHospitalAssn I’d like to see graphs of ‘new’ ICU admissions over time as we are now in (reportable) double digits. Declines in prevalence of icu admissions may be due to deaths or person no longer testing Covid +?

@OntHospitalAssn Let's see how removing #COVID19 precautions are going in places that tried it before us:
"On February 1st, Denmark dropped all COVID-19 protections (e.g. masks & vaccine passports)." https://t.co/I3aScNBc2o
@OntHospitalAssn @DFisman Are there "unofficial #ICU" cases..ppl kept just around the corner, in "regular wards"?  Asking for a friend.
@TOCam29 @OntHospitalAssn Last year Icu numbers plateau for most of February and then starting increasing in Mid-March. This year looks very different.
@OntHospitalAssn Both numbers now well below any point in the first half of last year. Let’s keep going…
